channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: You can soon watch movies, live sports on phone without the internet. Here’s how
Parents, sisters, wives, children: Imran Khan’s family tree decoded amid death rumours
In Graphics | Who are the Bnei Menashe? Why are they returning to Israel from India?
Who is Bandhu Maan Singh Sekhon? Gangster linked to firing at Kapil Sharma’s Canada café arrested
Imran Khan vs Asim Munir: Why Pak army chief is in the spotlight amid ex-PM’s death rumours
Gobble, gobble: Why do Americans eat turkey for Thanksgiving every year?
How Yunus repeats Khomeini’s playbook to bring Islamist rule in Bangladesh
item.description: Like Khomeini in the weeks before his seizure of power, Bangladesh’s interim leader Mohammad Yunus still speaks about democracy, human rights and justice to visiting diplomats and journalists, but only the most gullible or dishonest among them believe him

item.title: How Pakistan has mastered the art of projecting defeat as victory
item.description: Global military strongmen seeking to overthrow governments and install themselves as dictators must learn from Pakistan’s playbook on how to falsely project defeat as victory

item.title: China opens ‘Arctic Express’ route: Need to push Indian maritime corridors
item.description: India must expand Arctic engagement, strengthen maritime capabilities, deepen strategic partnerships, especially with Russia, and leverage new trade corridors to secure its geopolitical and economic interests amid intensifying global competition

item.title: Does Hu Yaobang’s vision on Tibet still matter?
item.description: According to Hu’s vision, Tibetans should fully exercise ‘nationality autonomy’ and truly be the masters of their own lives. Xi Jinping’s reference to Hu suggests that, even as Beijing pursues the complete sinicisation of its restive provinces, Hu’s vision has not been entirely buried

item.title: Strategic bonanza: Israel and India unlock next phase of partnership
item.description: Israel’s innovation ecosystem and India’s scale and manufacturing capabilities create a natural synergy

item.title: A tenuous truce: Can the updated US-Ukraine peace plan actually end the war?
item.description: Russia is highly unlikely to accept the ‘modified peace plan’ because the updated version incorporates key Ukrainian and European demands that directly contradict Moscow’s core objectives
